intro: Cryptocarya corrugata, commonly known as the rough-leaved cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its rough, fissured leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, with a distinctive corrugated texture that gives it its common name. Cryptocarya corrugata is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
